0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Non-neuropathic Gaucher's disease, chronic, symptomatic: initial, individualized dose (based on disease severity) IV over 1 to 2 h, dose range: 2.5 units/kg IV 3 times weekly to 60 units/kg IV every 1 to 4 wks; usual dosage: 60 units/kg IV every 2 wks
  • Non-neuropathic Gaucher's disease, chronic, symptomatic: maintenance, may attempt reducing dosage at 3 to 6 mo intervals after patient response is established

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Non-neuropathic Gaucher's disease, chronic, symptomatic: initial, individualized dose (based on disease severity) IV over 1 to 2 h, dose range: 2.5 units/kg IV 3 times weekly to 60 units/kg IV every 1 to 4 wks; usual dosage: 60 units/kg IV every 2 wks
  • Non-neuropathic Gaucher's disease, chronic, symptomatic: maintenance, may attempt reducing dosage at 3 to 6 mo intervals after patient response is established

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• alglucerase may be excreted in human milk
  • discontinue if signs of hypersensitivity develops
  • presence of androgen-sensitive malignancies; use with caution in prepubertal boys
  • alglucerase is derived from pooled human placental tissue and may contain viable viruses; risk of contamination is believed to be remote

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Swelling at injection site
  • Endocrine metabolic:Shivering
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal discomfort, Nausea, Vomiting
  • Neurologic:Pain
  • Other:Burning sensation, Fever
Serious
Immunologic:Anaphylaxis (rare)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Systemic: Alglucerase catalyzes the hydrolysis of the glycolipid glucocerebroside to glucose and ceramide as part of the normal degradation pathway for membrane lipids.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • should be filtered with an in-line particulate filter during infusion
  • do not shake solutions (may denature and inactivate the glycoprotein)
  • dilute with NS to a maximum final volume of 200 mL and infuse over 1 to 2 hrs
  • stable for up to 18 h after final dilution when store under refrigeration at 2 to 8 degrees Celsius (C)

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• symptomatic improvement
  • hematologic parameters, including hemoglobin, hematocrit, erythrocyte and platelet counts
  • IgG antibody formation
  • serum tryptase levels and complement activation; within 2 hours of developing hypersensitivity symptoms

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug is derived from pooled human placental tissue and may carry a remote risk of transmitting infectious agents. Risks and benefits should be discussed with patient by healthcare professional.
  • This drug may cause shivering, abdominal discomfort, nausea, vomiting, pain, burning sensation, or fever.
